properties.name: camel.component.smpp.address-range
properties.description: You can specify the address range for the SmppConsumer as defined in section 5.2.7 of the SMPP 3.4 specification. The SmppConsumer will receive messages only from SMSC's which target an address (MSISDN or IP address) within this range.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.alphabet
properties.description: Defines encoding of data according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 4: 8 bit Alphabet 8: UCS2 Alphabet

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.configuration
properties.description: To use the shared SmppConfiguration as configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.smpp.SmppConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.data-coding
properties.description: Defines the data coding according the SMPP 3.4 specification, section 5.2.19. Example data encodings are: 0: SMSC Default Alphabet 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1) 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary) 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646) 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990)

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.dest-addr
properties.description: Defines the destination SME address. For mobile terminated messages, this is the directory number of the recipient MS. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.dest-addr-npi
properties.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME destination address parameters. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum)

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.dest-addr-ton
properties.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME destination address parameters. Only for SubmitSm, SubmitMulti, CancelSm and DataSm. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the smpp component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.encoding
properties.description: Defines the encoding scheme of the short message user data. Only for SubmitSm, ReplaceSm and SubmitMulti.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.enquire-link-timer
properties.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the confidence checks. The confidence check is used to test the communication path between an ESME and an SMSC.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.http-proxy-host
properties.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the hostname or ip address of your HTTP proxy.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.http-proxy-password
properties.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the password required for your HTTP proxy.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.http-proxy-port
properties.description: If you need to tunnel SMPP through a HTTP proxy, set this attribute to the port of your HTTP proxy.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.http-proxy-username
properties.description: If your HTTP proxy requires basic authentication, set this attribute to the username required for your HTTP proxy.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.initial-reconnect-delay
properties.description: Defines the initial delay in milliseconds after the consumer/producer tries to reconnect to the SMSC, after the connection was lost.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.lazy-session-creation
properties.description: Sessions can be lazily created to avoid exceptions, if the SMSC is not available when the Camel producer is started. Camel will check the in message headers 'CamelSmppSystemId' and 'CamelSmppPassword' of the first exchange. If they are present, Camel will use these data to connect to the SMSC.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.max-reconnect
properties.description: Defines the maximum number of attempts to reconnect to the SMSC, if SMSC returns a negative bind response

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.message-receiver-route-id
properties.description: Set this on producer in order to benefit from transceiver (TRX) binding type. So once set, you don't need to define an 'SMTPP consumer' endpoint anymore. You would set this to a 'Direct consumer' endpoint instead. DISCALIMER: This feature is only tested with 'Direct consumer' endpoint. The behavior with any other consumer type is unknown and not tested.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.numbering-plan-indicator
properties.description: Defines the numeric plan indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum)

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.password
properties.description: The password for connecting to SMSC server.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.pdu-processor-degree
properties.description: Sets the number of threads which can read PDU and process them in parallel.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.pdu-processor-queue-capacity
properties.description: Sets the capacity of the working queue for PDU processing.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.priority-flag
properties.description: Allows the originating SME to assign a priority level to the short message. Only for SubmitSm and SubmitMulti. Four Priority Levels are supported: 0: Level 0 (lowest) priority 1: Level 1 priority 2: Level 2 priority 3: Level 3 (highest) priority

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.protocol-id
properties.description: The protocol id

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.proxy-headers
properties.description: These headers will be passed to the proxy server while establishing the connection.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.reconnect-delay
properties.description: Defines the interval in milliseconds between the reconnect attempts, if the connection to the SMSC was lost and the previous was not succeed.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.registered-delivery
properties.description: Is used to request an SMSC delivery receipt and/or SME originated acknowledgements. The following values are defined: 0: No SMSC delivery receipt requested. 1: SMSC delivery receipt requested where final delivery outcome is success or failure. 2: SMSC delivery receipt requested where the final delivery outcome is delivery failure.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.replace-if-present-flag
properties.description: Used to request the SMSC to replace a previously submitted message, that is still pending delivery. The SMSC will replace an existing message provided that the source address, destination address and service type match the same fields in the new message. The following replace if present flag values are defined: 0: Don't replace 1: Replace

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.service-type
properties.description: The service type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. The following generic service_types are defined: CMT: Cellular Messaging CPT: Cellular Paging VMN: Voice Mail Notification VMA: Voice Mail Alerting WAP: Wireless Application Protocol USSD: Unstructured Supplementary Services Data

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.session-state-listener
properties.description: You can refer to a org.jsmpp.session.SessionStateListener in the Registry to receive callbacks when the session state changed. The option is a org.jsmpp.session.SessionStateListener type.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.single-d-l-r
properties.description: When true, the SMSC delivery receipt would be requested only for the last segment of a multi-segment (long) message. For short messages, with only 1 segment the behaviour is unchanged.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.source-addr
properties.description: Defines the address of SME (Short Message Entity) which originated this message.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.source-addr-npi
properties.description: Defines the numeric plan indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME originator address parameters. The following NPI values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: ISDN (E163/E164) 2: Data (X.121) 3: Telex (F.69) 6: Land Mobile (E.212) 8: National 9: Private 10: ERMES 13: Internet (IP) 18: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum)

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.source-addr-ton
properties.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME originator address parameters. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.splitting-policy
properties.description: You can specify a policy for handling long messages: ALLOW - the default, long messages are split to 140 bytes per message TRUNCATE - long messages are split and only the first fragment will be sent to the SMSC. Some carriers drop subsequent fragments so this reduces load on the SMPP connection sending parts of a message that will never be delivered. REJECT - if a message would need to be split, it is rejected with an SMPP NegativeResponseException and the reason code signifying the message is too long.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.system-id
properties.description: The system id (username) for connecting to SMSC server.

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.system-type
properties.description: This parameter is used to categorize the type of ESME (External Short Message Entity) that is binding to the SMSC (max. 13 characters).

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.transaction-timer
properties.description: Defines the maximum period of inactivity allowed after a transaction, after which an SMPP entity may assume that the session is no longer active. This timer may be active on either communicating SMPP entity (i.e. SMSC or ESME).

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.type-of-number
properties.description: Defines the type of number (TON) to be used in the SME. The following TON values are defined: 0: Unknown 1: International 2: National 3: Network Specific 4: Subscriber Number 5: Alphanumeric 6: Abbreviated

properties.name: camel.component.smpp.using-s-s-l
properties.description: Whether using SSL with the smpps protocol
